decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Mirran Crusader and Serra Avenger. Using cards like Mother of Runes and Phyrexian Revoker to protect key pieces, the deck aims to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice to provide extra reach and card advantage, this deck looks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures quickly by using powerful lands like Ancient Tomb and Eye of Ugin. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to slow down opponents. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Endbringer while using Wasteland to disrupt their mana base. The inclusion of cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Dismember helps to deal with threats while Umezawa's Jitte provides additional utility. The deck's strategy revolves around quickly establishing a threatening board presence and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck is focused on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By playing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Magus of the Moon, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's development and disrupt their mana base. This allows for the deck to take control of the game and win through efficient beatdown with creatures like Mother of Runes and Flickerwisp, supported by powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. The deck also includes hate cards like Ethersworn Canonist to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Brainstorm, Careful Study, and Entomb, then bringing them back into play with cards like Reanimate and Exhume. It aims to cheat expensive creatures like Griselbrand and Iona into play early, overwhelming the opponent with huge threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by quickly reanimating powerful creatures and dominating the battlefield.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while aggressively applying pressure with efficient creatures and equipment. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's plays, combined with powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Eldrazi Displacer, the deck aims to control the board and establish a strong battlefield presence. The inclusion of disruptive land cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port further adds to the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's mana base and tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently and quickly assemble the Doomsday combo alongside various tools to protect and enable the combo. By utilizing cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Burning Wish, the deck aims to quickly dig through the library, set up the perfect stack of cards with Doomsday, and win the game by either drawing into Laboratory Maniac or using other means to secure victory. The deck also includes disruption tools like Cabal Therapy and Duress to control the opponent's game plan and ensure a successful combo finish.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with Dredge creatures and then utilize cards like Faithless Looting and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Breakthrough and Careful Study, the player is able to dredge through their deck quickly and efficiently. The deck's key win condition revolves around utilizing cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to quickly and efficiently set up its graveyard while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on creating a lock on the opponent by using lands strategically to control the game. By utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Gamble, and Crop Rotation, the deck can quickly assemble powerful combinations like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes various land destruction options, such as Wasteland and Rishadan Port, to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Additionally, cards like Punishing Fire and Maze of Ith provide additional ways to control the board and protect key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient land manipulation and control.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish board presence with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Deathrite Shaman, Wasteland, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to control the game through tempo plays such as Daze and Force of Will, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Murderous Cut and Dismember. The mana base is designed to support a mix of black, blue, and green spells, with access to key lands like Bayou and Creeping Tar Pit to help close out games.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with powerful aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. Utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure while also using disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Garruk Relentless for added versatility and removal options. The mana base is optimized for efficiency and consistency, allowing the deck to consistently deliver threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game while utilizing the graveyard as a resource through cards like Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire. It aims to disrupt the opponent with cards like Abrupt Decay and Chalice of the Void, while also putting pressure on them with creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant. The deck also has a land package that includes utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas, as well as combo potential with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient control and resource management.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then bring them back to the battlefield using Reanimate and Exhume. The deck also includes protection cards like Force of Will and Daze to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. Additionally, there is a small Show and Tell package for alternative ways to cheat creatures into play. This combo-reanimator strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on a versatile strategy that combines aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman with disruptive spells like Abrupt Decay and Thoughtseize. The goal is to control the board while applying pressure on the opponent, using cards like Shardless Agent and Ancestral Vision to generate card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Baleful Strix provides additional versatility and power to outmaneuver opponents. Wasteland is also included to disrupt opposing mana bases, further solidifying this deck's strategy of maintaining control while applying pressure.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats that can end the game quickly. By combining efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Baleful Strix with powerful disruption spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach, the deck can control the game and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines like Shardless Agent and Ancestral Vision to ensure a steady stream of resources. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a balance between aggression and control, allowing it to adapt to different matchups effectively.

The main strategy of this Combo - Storm deck is to quickly generate a critical mass of mana through efficient rituals and mana-producing artifacts, and then cast a large storm spell such as Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of discard spells like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is designed to win the game in explosive fashion by chaining together spells to generate a lethal storm count.

This deck heavily relies on the synergy between Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's spells effectively. It also includes a strong suite of counter spells and removal to deal with threats. The addition of Entreat the Angels provides a win condition in the late game, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Vendilion Clique offer additional card advantage and disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to support all the necessary colors for the deck to function smoothly.
